page.title: 13The Canal Locks
page.content: The lock on the river Ure in Boroughbridge was built in 1942.The river splits up at the locks, one way goes past the bridge and the other goes past the lock and they meet again after the waterfalls.The river Ure leads from Boroughbridge to Ripon and from Ripon it leads down to the river Ouse that runs through York. The wood of the locks is getting old but it will last for a few years yet .The locks are very well equiped with fish so its good for fishing.The boats can go to York from the lock and Ripon or just round Boroughbridge.The lock is controlled by a handle which you turn round to open the gates to let the water into the locks.The canal was built in 1767 and it is still used today.
